intro: Daviesia bursarioides, commonly known as the narrow-leafed broom, is a shrub native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, characterized by its pod fruits and often nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces yellow or orange flowers in late winter to spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Daviesia bursarioides is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its hardy nature and ability to stabilize soils.
